    • Field Detail

      • hasMoved

        public boolean hasMoved
        The rook also includes a hasMoved variable because a rook can only castle if it has not moved yet.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rook

        public Rook(java.lang.String color,
            Chessboard board,
            int row,
            int column)
        Rook constructor

        The constructor for Rook calls the ChessPiece super constructor.

        Parameters:
        color - Description: The color of the Rook. Can be w or b for white and black.
        board - Description: The chessboard the Rook is located in.
        row - Description: The row the Rook starts on in the chessboard.
        column - Description: The column the Rook starts on in the chessboard.

    • Method Detail

      • getAvailableMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAvailableMoves()
        Gets all available moves for the Rook.

        determines the legal squares that this Rook can move to from its current location Rooks can move: As far as the player would like in an unblocked horizontal or vertical line

        Specified by:
        getAvailableMoves in class ChessPiece
        Returns:
        Description: Returns the ArrayList of all possible moves the Rook can take from its current location.

      • move

        public void move(java.lang.String command)
        Overwrites default move function from ChessPiece

        This function returns nothing and moves the Rook piece to the designated location by calling the super class move function and then updating to confirm the piece is not in its starting position

        Overrides:
        move in class ChessPiece
        Parameters:
        command - Description: the designated location to travel to for this Rook piece.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the String representation of this piece.

        Returns a String representation of this piece, which is its one-letter color appended by "R", representing its status as a Rook.

        Specified by:
        toString in class ChessPiece
        Returns:
        Description: Returns the string representation of this piece.
